intro: Fimbristylis dichotoma var. satpudensis, commonly known as the Satpuda sedge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of India. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in wet, rocky habitats at higher elevations. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphological features and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
